column1: Symptoms of a centipede bite are: - Pain in the area of the bite - Swelling in the area of the bite - Redness in the area of the bite - Lymph node swelling (rare) - Numbness in the area of the bite (rare) People who are allergic to centipede venom may also have: - Difficulty breathing - Rapid heart rate - Throat swelling
If the person has problems with blood circulation, decrease the time to prevent possible damage to the skin.
A trip to the emergency room may not be needed unless the person has an allergic reaction, but contact poison control just to make sure.
